author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: َّتِكَ وَتَبَلْبَلَ بِما اعْتَرَتْهُمُ الأَحْزانُ عِنْدَ ظُهُورِ أَمْرِكَ وَتَمَوُّجِ أَبْحُرِ فَضْلِكَ وَأَلْطافِكَ، أَيْ رَبِّ مِنْ زَفَراتِ قُلُوبِهِمْ ارْتَفَعَتْ زَفْرَتِي وَمِنْ احْتِراقِ قُلُوبِهِمْ احْتَرَقَ قَلْبِيْ، أَسْئَلُكَ يا مالِكَ الوُجُودِ وَمُرَبِّيَ الغَيْبِ وَالشُّهُودِ بِأَنْ تَجْعَ
translation: The power of Thy might beareth me witness! My heart hath melted by reason of my love for them that are dear to Thee, and my soul is laden with anguish for the sorrows which have afflicted them at the revelation of Thy Cause and the appearance of the billowing oceans of Thy grace and favors. The sighs they uttered, O my Lord, have caused my sighs to ascend towards Thee, and the burning of their hearts hath consumed mine own heart within me.
